defaultValue.en-US: Pueblo Unido creates hope for and amplifies the voices of communities with vulnerable immigration status by connecting them to legal, social, and Indigenous language interpretation services.
defaultValue.es: Pueblo Unido crea esperanza y amplifica las voces de las comunidades con estatus migratorio vulnerable al conectarlas con servicios legales, sociales e interpretación de idiomas originarios.

heading.es: Empoderando a la comunidad inmigrante de Portland

subHeading.en-US: Join PIRC in building a more just and inclusive community for all.
subHeading.es: Únase a PIRC en la construcción de una comunidad más justa e inclusiva para todos.

text.en-US: Your support empowers our fight for immigrant justice.
text.es: Su apoyo fortalece nuestra lucha por la justicia para los inmigrantes.

textCallout.en-US: We support immigrant rights through direct assistance, education, legal support, and advocacy.
textCallout.es: Apoyamos los derechos de los inmigrantes a través de asistencia directa, educación, apoyo legal, y defensa.

subheading.en-US: Since 2005, the Portland Immigrant Rights Coalition (PIRC) has been defending the rights of immigrants in our community through education, rapid response, and legal support.
subheading.es: Desde 2005, la Coalición por los Derechos de los Inmigrantes de Portland (PIRC, por sus siglas en inglés) ha estado defendiendo los derechos de los inmigrantes en nuestra comunidad a través de la educación, la respuesta rápida y el apoyo legal.

text1.en-US: Founded by a group of approximately 50 activists and community members.
text1.es: Fundada por un grupo de aproximadamente 50 activistas y miembros de la comunidad.

text2.en-US: Organized one of the largest marches in Portland's history for May Day.
text2.es: Organizó una de las marchas más grandes en la historia de Portland para el Primero de Mayo.

text3.es: Organizó una de las marchas más grandes en la historia de Portland para el Primero de Mayo.

tier1Subheading.en-US: Help us respond to one ICE raid alert.
tier1Subheading.es: Ayúdenos a responder a una alerta de redada de ICE.

tier2Subheading.en-US: Support a family facing deportation for one week.
tier2Subheading.es: Apoye a una familia que enfrenta la deportación durante una semana.

tier3Subheading.en-US: Fund a community rights education workshop.
tier3Subheading.es: Financiar un taller de educación sobre derechos comunitarios.

subheading.en-US: From rapid response to courtroom battles, see  how PIRC is making a difference.
subheading.es: Desde respuestas rápidas hasta batallas judiciales, vea cómo PIRC está marcando la diferencia.

subheading.en-US: This is just a test block
Volunteer, donate, or spread the word - every action counts in our fight for immigrant rights.
subheading.es: Sea voluntario, done o difunda el mensaje: cada acción cuenta en nuestra lucha por los derechos de los inmigrantes.

text.en-US: Since 2005, the Portland Immigrant Rights Coalition (PIRC) has been on the front lines, defending the rights of immigrants in our community.
text.es: Desde 2005, la Coalición por los Derechos de los Inmigrantes de Portland (PIRC, por sus siglas en inglés) ha estado en primera línea, defendiendo los derechos de los inmigrantes en nuestra comunidad.

heading.es: De las bases a las organizaciones sin fines de lucro

content.value: Since 2005, PIRC has demonstrated its ability to mobilize large numbers of people, provide crucial services during critical moments (like ICE raids), and adapt its structure to meet evolving needs.

The current focus on achieving organizational independence while maintaining and expanding services reflects PIRC's commitment to long-term sustainability and increased impact in the immigrant rights landscape.

Desde 2005, PIRC ha demostrado su capacidad para movilizar grandes cantidades de personas, brindar servicios cruciales durante momentos críticos (como las redadas de ICE) y adaptar su estructura para satisfacer las necesidades cambiantes.

El enfoque actual en lograr la independencia organizacional mientras se mantienen y amplían los servicios refleja el compromiso de PIRC con la sostenibilidad a largo plazo y un mayor impacto en el panorama de los derechos de los inmigrantes.

description.es: Los activistas se unieron para formar PIRC.
La gente se movilizó el Primero de Mayo.

text.en-US: Empowering immigrants, uniting families, and building a just community in Portland and beyond.
text.es: Empoderar a los inmigrantes, unir familias y construir una comunidad justa en Portland y más allá.

heading.en-US: Know Your Rights, Protect Your Future
heading.es: Conozca sus derechos, proteja su futuro

content.value: At PIRC, we respond flexibly and quickly to the needs of communities facing detention and deportation through our statewide hotline. We train allied communities to support their neighbors. We show up each day to hold immigration agents accountable. And we are building an immigrant-justice community across the state of Oregon.

En PIRC, respandemos con flexibilidad y rapidez a las necesidades de las comunidades que enfrentan detenciones y deportaciones a través de nuestra linea estatal. Formamos a comunidades aliadas para que puedan apoyar a sus vecinos. Acompaňamos cada día paro exigir responsabilidad a los agentes de inmigración. Y estamos construyendo uno red de justicia para inmigrantes en todo el estado de Oregón.
Taken more than
20,000 calls
from people reporting ICE presence, seeking support, or needing help in the wake of a detention.
Referred nearly
1,000 detained community members
from across the state to rapid response legal support and hundreds of community members to social services, including mutual aid & direct accompaniment.
Held a
daily presence
at the ZPortland Immigration Court & Portland ICE building to provide
legal observation, support,
and
rapid response
activation.
Trained more than
5,000 rapid response Migra Watcherse
from all across the state & activated Migra Watchers to respond to hundreds of incidents of suspected and confirmed ICE activity.
Opened & operated on
immigrant resource center
to support hundreds of community members seeking support around ICE check-ins, as well as families seeking information about detained loved ones.
Atendido más de
20,000 llamadas
de personas que reportaron actividad de ICE, buscaron apoyo o necesitaban ayuda después de una detención.
Referido a casi
miembros de la comunidad detenidos en todo el estado para apoyo legal de respuesta rápida, y a cientos de personas para servicios comunitarios, incluyendo ayuda mutua y acompaňamiento directo.
Mantenido una
presencia diaria
en la Corte de Inmigración de Portland y en el edificio de ICE en Portland para hacer
observación legal,
brindar
apoyo
y activar
respuestas rápidas.
Capacitado a más de
5,000 voluntarios de respuesta rápida
de Migra Watch en todo el estado, y activado a Migra Watchers para responder a cientos de incidentes de actividad de ICE, tanto sospechadas como confirmada.
Abierto y operado un
centro de recursos para inmigrantes,
brindando apoyo a cientos de miembros de la comunidad que necesitan asistencia con sus citas de ICE, así como a familias buscando información sobre seres queridos detenidos.

heading.es: Amplificando voces, influyendo en el cambio

content.value: We actively engage with policymakers and media to share immigrant stories and challenge injustices.
Colaboramos activamente con los responsables políticos y los medios de comunicación para compartir historias de inmigrantes y desafiar las injusticias.
From guidance for newcomers to assistance during crises, we provide comprehensive support to keep immigrant families strong and united.
Desde orientación para recién llegados hasta asistencia durante las crisis, brindamos apoyo integral para mantener a las familias inmigrantes fuertes y unidas.

text.en-US: Since 2005, the Portland Immigrant Rights Coalition (PIRC) has been on the front lines, defending the rights of immigrants in our community. Your donation today helps us continue this vital work.
text.es: Desde 2005, la Coalición por los Derechos de los Inmigrantes de Portland (PIRC) ha estado en primera línea, defendiendo los derechos de los inmigrantes en nuestra comunidad. Su donación de hoy nos ayuda a continuar con esta labor vital.

content.value: Respond rapidly to ICE raids, providing legal observers and immediate assistance
Educate immigrants about their rights through workshops and training sessions
Operate our critical hotline, a lifeline for those facing detention or deportation
Support families with resources for food, housing, and legal aid
Advocate for just immigration policies at local and national levels
Responder rápidamente a las redadas de ICE, proporcionando observadores legales y asistencia inmediata
Educar a los inmigrantes sobre sus derechos a través de talleres y sesiones de capacitación
Operar nuestra línea directa crítica, una línea de vida para quienes enfrentan detención o deportación
Apoyar a las familias con recursos para alimentos, vivienda y asistencia legal
Abogar por políticas de inmigración justas a nivel local y nacional

text.en-US: Your support empowers our fight for immigrant justice.
text.es: Su apoyo fortalece nuestra lucha por la justicia para los inmigrantes.

content.value: We are not hiring for any full-time positions at the moment. Check back soon!

subheading.en-US: A set of PDFs containing guides to knowing your rights.
subheading.es: Un conjunto de archivos PDF que contienen guías para conocer sus derechos.

heading.en-US: Keep Portland a Sanctuary for All – Donate to Protect Immigrant Families
heading.es: Mantengamos a Portland como un santuario para todos: hagamos una donación para proteger a las familias inmigrantes

body.en-US: By donating today, you’re fueling the fight for immigrant rights in Portland. Your support allows us to provide crucial legal defense resources, maintain our community hotline, and ensure no one faces deportation alone. Together, we can make Portland a true sanctuary for all.
body.es: Al donar hoy, estás impulsando la lucha por los derechos de los inmigrantes en Portland. Tu apoyo nos permite brindar recursos de defensa legal cruciales, mantener nuestra línea directa comunitaria y asegurarnos de que nadie se enfrente solo a la deportación. Juntos, podemos hacer de Portland un verdadero santuario para todos.

topLine.es: Llama a la línea directa de PIRC

content.value: Description:

In collaboration with partners, PIRC’s Hotline Manager & Trainer will be responsible for overseeing the successful operation of PIRC’s statewide immigrant rights hotline, integrating and training volunteers, and helping actualize a statewide rapid response plan. Click the button below to read the full description & apply!
Descripción

: En colaboración con los socios, el gerente y capacitador de la línea directa de PIRC será responsable de supervisar el funcionamiento exitoso de la línea directa estatal de PIRC sobre derechos de los inmigrantes, integrar y capacitar a los voluntarios y ayudar a implementar un plan de respuesta rápida a nivel estatal. ¡Haga clic en el botón a continuación para leer la descripción completa y postularse!

text.es: Gerente y capacitador de línea directa

content.value: Description:

The PIRC Coordinator will take lead on PIRC’s administrative work to strengthen PIRC's internal systems. The Coordinator will also take lead on working with partners to vision and create a statewide rapid response plan, building relationships with partners, funders, and key electeds to ensure PIRC's deportation defense work is a success. Click the button below to read the full description & apply!
Descripción

: El Coordinador del PIRC se encargará del trabajo administrativo del PIRC para fortalecer los sistemas internos del PIRC. El Coordinador también se encargará de trabajar con socios para visualizar y crear un plan de respuesta rápida a nivel estatal, establecer relaciones con socios, financiadores y funcionarios electos clave para garantizar que el trabajo de defensa contra la deportación del PIRC sea un éxito. ¡Haga clic en el botón a continuación para leer la descripción completa y postularse!
Want to get involved with PIRC as a volunteer?
Fill out this form
. Thank you!

text.es: ¡Únete a la junta directiva de PIRC!

content.value: We are seeking two new board members to join us in this dynamic moment in our immigration justice work. PIRC seeks one board member to take on the role of treasurer and a second board member with experience in grant writing and building relationships with foundations, to support incoming staff who will be working on fundraising.
Click here
for details & how to apply!

Estamos buscando dos nuevos miembros de la junta directiva para que se unan a nosotros en este momento dinámico en nuestro trabajo de justicia migratoria. PIRC busca un miembro de la junta directiva para asumir el papel de tesorero y un segundo miembro de la junta directiva con experiencia en la redacción de subvenciones y el establecimiento de relaciones con fundaciones, para apoyar al personal entrante que trabajará en la recaudación de fondos. ¡
Haga clic aquí
para obtener más detalles y cómo presentar una solicitud!

subheading.en-US: Join our team! We have volunteer and full-time positions currently open. Click below to learn more.
subheading.es: ¡Únete a nuestro equipo! Actualmente tenemos vacantes para voluntarios y puestos de tiempo completo. Haz clic a continuación para obtener más información.

headingText.en-US: Benefit for Portland Immigrant Rights Coalition
headingText.es: Benefit for Portland Immigrant Rights Coalition

name.en-US: People's Guide to Northwest Detention Center

content.value: The PIRC hotline has seen an exponential increase in the amount of calls we have been receiving during this current assault on our communities. The hotline is staffed almost entirely by volunteers who are working around the clock to be able to respond to this crisis. In order to help us meet the challenges of this moment and in order to center those most impacted, we have an ask of the community.
Please continue to CALL the hotline with any urgent concerns:
You are witnessing ICE presence (suspected or confirmed)
You have witnessed or have information about an ICE detention
You’re looking for a missing loved one
Please TEXT the hotline with nonurgent issues:
Questions about accessing non urgent resources (as long as it isn’t needed within the next 24 hours).
Photos of possible ICE sightings, license plates, etc If urgent please call first before sending text messages
Please EMAIL:
press@pircoregon.org
for any media inquiries
volunteer@pircoregon.org
for questions about volunteering.
pircpdx@gmail.com
for questions about donating or any other general inquiries.
pircpdx@gmail.com
with any VIDEO footage of ICE activity (please be sure to include information about date, time, location, any other relevant info)

body.es: Noticias de última hora y actualizaciones rápidas

body.es: Fotos y vídeos de nuestros eventos

subheading.en-US: For access to multilingual flyers from PIRC, click the button below.
subheading.es: Para acceder a folletos multilingües de PIRC, haz clic en el botón de abajo.

content.value: 81 detentions were reported to the hotline between 11/17 - 11/23
That brings the monthly reported detentions for November thus far to 304
Se reportaron 81 detenciones a la línea de PIRC entre el 17 y el 23 de noviembre
Total de detenciones mensuales reportadas en noviembre: 304 seres queridos.
On 11/19, there was very high immigration enforcement activity in Lane County.
There was also higher than normal ICE and BP presence in Clackamas county, in places like Milwaukie, Canby, and Oregon City on 11/20.
On 11/22, a number of Oregonians were detained in Washington, in the Vancouver & Longview areas.
Detentions were also reported throughout the week in Portland, McMinnville, Newberg, Gresham, Tigard, Beaverton, Cornelius, and Hillsboro.

ICE & Border Patrol continue to racially profile and attempt to criminalize solidarity work. Four US Citizens were detained this past week - two were collateral immigration arrests and two were targeted for observing and filming ICE & BP.
El 19/11, hubo una actividad muy intensa de ICE en el condado de Lane.
También hubo una presencia de ICE y las Patrullas Fronterizadas mas intenso de lo normal en el condado de Clackamas, en lugares como Milwaukie, Canby y Oregon City el 20/11.
El 22/11, varios residentes de Oregón fueron detenidos en Washington, en las áreas de Vancouver y Longview.
También se reportaron detenciones durante la semana en Portland, McMinnville, Newberg, Gresham, Tigard, Beaverton, Cornelius y Hillsboro.

ICE y la Patrulla Fronteriza continúan usando perfiles raciales e intentando criminalizar el trabajo solidario. Cuatro ciudadanos estadounidenses fueron detenidos la semana pasada: dos fueron arrestos migratorios colaterales y dos fueron arrestados por observar y filmar a ICE y Patrulla Fronteriza.
If you are in SW Washington, you can call LULAC’s hotline for support: 503-388-5356. In the rest of Washington state, call WAISN: 844-724-3737.

Join the campaign to urge cities across Oregon to turn off their Flock cameras! We know that immigration enforcement agents are using surveillance technology, including databases and license plate readers and similar, to target our communities. Check out the work led by our partners at ACLU of Oregon (@aclu_org) and Latinos Unidos Siempre (@lusyouth) to take action.
Si se encuentra en el suroeste de Washington, puede llamar a la línea directa de LULAC para obtener apoyo: 503-388-5356. En el resto del estado de Washington, llame a WAISN: 844-724-3737.

¡Únase a la campaña para decir a las ciudades de Oregón a apagar sus cámaras Flock! Sabemos que los agentes de inmigración están utilizando tecnología de vigilancia, como bases de datos, lectores de matrículas y similares, para atacar a nuestras comunidades. Para mas informacion, sigue el trabajo que realizan nuestras colegas de la ACLU de Oregón (@aclu_org) y Latinos Unidos Siempre (@lusyouth)  para tomar medidas.

heading.es: Cita de "La Comunidad Nos Mantiene Seguros"

content.value: “I got my first ice activation message this morning. I had just returned from them and was going to get my breakfast but instead I got back in my car and drove 10 minutes to the parking lot where the ice vehicle was…people just kept coming and showing up and finally the vehicle left….I’ll tell you, it was so heartwarming to see how many people just put down everything they were doing…We can do this! Together.”

“Recibí mi primer mensaje de activación de ICE esta mañana. Acababa de regresar del gimnasio e iba a desayunar, pero en lugar de eso, volví a mi auto y maneje 10 minutos hasta el estacionamiento donde estaba el vehículo de ICE… la gente seguía llegando y apareciendo, y finalmente el vehículo se fue… Les digo, fue muy conmovedor ver cuántas personas dejaron todo lo que estaban haciendo… ¡Podemos lograrlo! Juntos”.

heading.es: Amigos de PIRC de la semana:

content.value: One of PIRC’s closest partners is the CLEAR Clinic, a legal organization that offers criminal record expungement, tenant advocacy, gender marker & name change services, and immigration legal defense. The CLEAR Clinic co-holds our ICE legal observer program, sends rapid response attorneys to the Portland ICE Office every week, and is a critical resource for community members who reach out to PIRC. If you need free legal support in any of the areas mentioned above, check them out at
clear-clinic.org

Uno de las organizaciones con quien trabajamos mucho en PIRC es la Clínica CLEAR, una organización legal que ofrece eliminación de antecedentes penales, defensa de inquilinos, servicios de cambio de nombre y marcador de género, y defensa legal de inmigración. La Clínica CLEAR co-coordina nuestro programa de observadores legales de ICE, envía abogados de respuesta rápida a la Oficina de ICE de Portland cada semana y es un recurso fundamental para los miembros de la comunidad que contactan a PIRC. Si necesita asistencia legal gratuita en cualquiera de las áreas mencionadas, consúltela en clear-clinic.org.
96 detentions this 11/10-11/16 were reported to the PIRC hotline, and
219 detentions have been reported since November 1st
October detention heat map (please note this does not represent the full extent of detentions reported in October but rather where we had an approximate address reported)
Se reportaron 96 detenciones entre el 10 y el 16 de noviembre a la línea directa de PIRC, y
219 detenciones reportados desde el 1 de noviembre.
One possible option to consider if you feel unsafe driving right now is getting a ride from someone you trust, or taking public transportation as it is available!
We have seen an increase in the number of suspected ICE activity near schools, causing fear and frustration for families, neighbors and staff alike.

Many of these schools have parents and teachers organizing already; if this is something you are interested in supporting, please coordinate with your local school community and teachers, as there may be additional support that those communities would like your support with!

Se reportaron detenciones en lugares que no han tenido una alta actividad de ICE recientamente, como The Dalles, Hood River, Gervis y Lincoln City; el mayor número de detenciones se reportó en Salem, Beaverton y Hillsboro; así como en Cornelius, Forest Grove, McMinnville, Gresham, Sherwood, Woodburn, Fairview, Aloha y Portland también.
La mayoría de estas detenciones ocurrieron en carros, con personas yendo a actividades cotidianas como el trabajo.
Did you know that you can access free food using the Oregon Food Bank’s FoodFinder website? It’s available in many languages and you can filter based on day/time, zipcode and more! Visit
https://foodfinder.oregonfoodbank.org/

¿Sabías que puedes encontrar alimentación gratuita a través del sitio web “FoodFinder” del Banco de Alimentos de Oregón? Está disponible en varios idiomas y puedes filtrar por día/hora, código postal y más. Visita
https://foodfinder.oregonfoodbank.org/
Privacy Policy of Portland Immigrant Rights Coalition (PIRC)

PIRC values your privacy and we are committed to protecting your personal information. We collect personal information such as your name, email address, and phone number to enable PIRC to organize, train, track, communicate with, and dispatch volunteers on an efficient and personalized basis (PIRC’s Services).
PIRC’s website allows volunteers to sign up for some of our programs. This policy informs website visitors of how PIRC collects, uses, and protects personal information of PIRC volunteers.

If you choose to sign up for PIRC’s Services, then you agree to the collection and use of information in relation to this policy. The personal information we collect are used for PIRC’s Services, including managing and improving PIRC’s volunteer programs. We will not sell, use, or share your personal information with anyone except as described in this Privacy Policy, and we will not keep your personal information for longer than we need it.
Information Collection and Use

To register and participate in PIRC’s Services, PIRC will require you to provide us with certain personally identifiable information, including but not limited to your name, email address, phone number, and postal address. The information that we collect will be used only for PIRC’s Services. We will not use your personal information for any other purpose or share it with third-parties except PIRC Service Providers, as outlined below.  We will share your personal information only when you give us permission, the law requires it, or it is necessary to protect the rights of PIRC or others. You have the right to correct inaccurate information or request deletion of your personal information.
Usage Data

PIRC does not collect information that your browser sends to us, called Log Data. Log Data may include information such as your computer's Internet Protocol (“IP”) address, browser version, pages of our website that you visit, the time and date of your visit, the time spent on those pages, and other statistics.
PIRC Service Providers

PIRC may employ third-party companies, individuals, or volunteers to facilitate PIRC’s Services or to provide PIRC’s Services on our behalf. These third parties may have access to your personal information to perform PIRC’s Services. However, they are obligated not to disclose or use the information for any other purpose.
Data Security

PIRC values your trust in providing us your personal information, and we will take all reasonable steps to protect it. Notwithstanding our data security measures, unfortunately all users should recognize that no online service is impenetrable.
Links to Other Sites

Our website may contain links to other sites. If you click on a third-party link, you will be directed to that site. Note that these external sites are not operated by us. Therefore, we strongly advise you to review the Privacy Policy of these websites. We have no control over, and assume no responsibility for the content, privacy policies, or practices of any third-party sites or services.
Children's Privacy

PIRC does not allow individuals under the age of 18 to volunteer in our programs, and we do not knowingly collect personal identifiable information from children. If we discover that a minor has provided us with personal information, we immediately delete this from our servers.
Changes to This Privacy Policy and Contact

We may update our Privacy Policy from time to time. Thus, we advise you to review this page periodically for any changes. We will notify you of any changes by posting the new Privacy Policy on this page. If you have any questions or suggestions about PIRC’s Privacy Policy, please contact us at
pircpdx@gmail.com
PIRC Hotline Event Notifications Terms of Service
1. When you opt in to notifications from PIRC,  you may receive messages to confirm your enrollment, alerts about ICE activity in your vicinity, and notifications about community events.

2. You can cancel the SMS service at any time. Just text "STOP" to the short code. After you send the SMS message "STOP" to us, we will send you an SMS message to confirm that you have been unsubscribed. After this, you will no longer receive SMS messages from us. If you want to join again, just sign up as you did the first time and we will start sending SMS messages to you again.
3. If you are experiencing issues with the messaging program you can reply with the keyword HELP for more assistance, or you can get help directly at volunteers@pircoregon.org.
4. Carriers are not liable for delayed or undelivered messages

5. As always, message and data rates may apply for any messages sent to you from us and to us from you. You will receive messages when ICE activity is in your vicinity, which may happen several times per day. If you have any questions about your text plan or data plan, it is best to contact your wireless provider.
6. If you have any questions regarding privacy, please read
our privacy policy

content.value: Detentions and some ICE agents are present in Forest Grove this morning:
On Ave 24
Pacific Avenue and TV Highway
Intersection of Alder and Lombard
3700 Pacific Avenue
Be careful in this area, and if you see agents or are suspicious, call 1-888-622-1510.

Detenciones y alta presencia de agentes de ICE en Forest Grove esta mañana:
•en ave. 24
•Pacific Avenue y TV hwy
•Alder con Lombard
•3700 Pacific Avenue

Tenga mucha precaución en esta zona y si ve agentes o algo sospechoso llame a 1-888-622-1510
